info.game_comments:
1997 Power Players Week game 5.
From DAR Constitution Hall in Washington, D.C.

(1, 1).clue: In 1974 this organization granted the PLO observer status & suspended South Africa

(2, 1).clue: The title fawn in Disney's 1942 film is this deer

(3, 1).clue: On St. Patrick's Day, customers clamor for Joe's Irish Shillelagh, which features this "Irish" liquor

(4, 1).clue: R.J. Reynolds dropped this drawn character after drawing complaints it drew kids to cigarettes

(5, 1).clue: In her book "My Turn", she points out that Eleanor Roosevelt was criticized for ordering new china, too

(6, 1).clue: The American Heritage Dictionary defines this word as "one who digs graves"

(1, 2).clue: The Braves tried to bench this player so he'd break the Babe's record in Atlanta, but was ordered to play him

(2, 2).clue: Monstro is the monstrous whale who swallows Geppetto in this beloved film

(4, 2).clue: From its start in 1993, this Steven Bochco show has been attacked by the Christian Family Network

(5, 2).clue: She donated the net proceeds of her dog Millie's book to her Foundation for Family Literacy

(6, 2).clue: Queensland & New South Wales cover eastern Australia & this state covers western Australia

(1, 3).clue: The Symbionese Liberation Army kidnapped this heiress & demanded food for the poor as a ransom

(2, 3).clue: Mowgli finds out it's a jungle out there in this film based on Kipling's classic

(4, 3).clue: In July 1997 the National Federation for the Blind urged a halt to a live-action version of this cartoon

(5, 3).clue: First Lady seen here when she was a young girl:

(1, 4).clue: John Connally "got" trouble from campaign contributions he "got" from producers of this product

(2, 4).clue: The Mickey Mouse version of this Dickens classic features Goofy as the ghost of Jacob Marley

(4, 4).clue: A 1989 protest by a Michigan housewife against this Fox sitcom only boosted its popularity

(5, 4).clue: This Texas-born conservationist headed the First Lady's Committee for A More Beautiful Capital

(1, 5).clue: The Western Hemisphere's first female head of state was this country's Isabel Peron

(2, 5).clue: Famous voices in this film include Ed Wynn as the Mad Hatter & Jerry Colonna as the March Hare

(4, 5).clue: Ira Zimmerman led a protest of the mocking of Michael Palin's stuttering in this 1988 film

(5, 5).clue: She started wearing those famous bangs while living in the Panama Canal Zone with her military husband

(1, 1).clue: He was born in the capital Nov. 25, 1960, 17 days after his dad was elected president

(2, 1).clue: A spare on a car, or an extra person on a double date

(3, 1).clue: Robert De Niro, for "Cape Fear";Anthony Hopkins, for "The Silence of the Lambs";Warren Beatty, for "Bugsy"

(4, 1).clue: In "Paper Lion" George Plimpton reported on his attempt to play this sport

(5, 1).clue: Seattleites Bill Gates & Paul Allen started this company in Albuquerque, then moved home to Washington

(6, 1).clue: Middle initial of John Public, or of sixth president John Adams

(1, 2).clue: Lisa Halaby, born in D.C. in 1951, married King Hussein & became Queen Noor of this country

(2, 2).clue: On the fifth day God created these, like the one that swallowed Jonah

(3, 2).clue: Rosie Perez, for "Fearless";Holly Hunter, for "The Firm";Anna Paquin, for "The Piano"

(4, 2).clue: A 1996 history of this substance includes sections on bakelite, polyethylene & cellophane

(5, 2).clue: The Melvins, heard here, were an early band in this rock genre that swept America in 1992:

(1, 3).clue: He was born in Washington on Jan. 1, 1895 & became the FBI's director at 29

(2, 3).clue: On this date in 1776 the Declaration of Independence was mailed to towns across the colonies

(3, 3).clue: Vanessa Redgrave, for "Howards End";Joan Plowright, for "Enchanted April";Marisa Tomei, for "My Cousin Vinny"

(4, 3).clue: Frank McCourt put his mother's name in the title of this bestselling memoir

(1, 4).clue: This TV journalist, who longed for parenthood, is the 10th child of a Chinese diplomat

(2, 4).clue: A fifth of liquor is one-fifth of this measure

(4, 4).clue: The title of this 1994 book about group differences in intelligence refers to a shape on a graph

(2, 5).clue: In 1967 they rose to the Top 10 singing "Up, Up And Away In My Beautiful Balloon"

(4, 5).clue: Song that's the title of Robert Dallek's book on "The Making and Unmaking of American Presidents"

(0, 0).clue: In September 1997 this branch of the U.S. Armed Services celebrated its 50th anniversary
